Package com.example.cmput301f24mikasa

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.cmput301f24mikasa.Event
public class Event extends Object
Represents an event in the application. This class includes the details of an event such as title, description, start date, capacity, price, and associated poster and device IDs. It provides an empty constructor required for Firestore serialization, and a parameterized constructor for creating an event with specific details.

Fields in this class are designed to map to Firestore document fields for easy data storage and retrieval.

Since:
2024-11-08

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Empty constructor required for Firestore serialization.

    • Event

      public Event(String eventID, String title, String description, String startDate, int capacity, String price, com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference posterRef, String deviceID, String imageURL)
      Constructs an Event object with specified details.
      Parameters:
      eventID - Unique identifier for the event.
      title - Title of the event.
      description - Description of the event.
      startDate - Start date of the event.
      capacity - Maximum capacity of attendees.
      price - Price of the event.
      posterRef - Reference to the event's poster document in Firestore.
      deviceID - Device ID of the event creator.
